record.dc:title: 400AN15 Johnson Farm, Anderson County, Tennessee. Burial 2 - (top) Young adult female in good condition. Head to south, lying on right side, face to right. Fully flexed. Burial 3 - (bottom) Indeterminate infant in fair condition (skull broken by shovel). Head to east, lying on back, arms along sides. Partially flexed.
record.wpa:narrative: [Burial 2] Both hands between legs at pubis bone and child one foot from end of foot. Two clay vessels are associated with this burial; one between face and knees, the other touching right temporal bone. [Burial 3] Skull 1' north of left foot of adult. Workman cut through skull of this burial before discovery. Probable cause of disarrangement of 1 leg (one leg flexed back over pelvis).
